entity.name: Roman - Juno
entity.subtitle: Queen of Gods, Marriage, Childbirth & State Protection
entity.description: Juno is the queen of the Roman pantheon, divine consort of Jupiter, and protector of women, marriage, and the Roman state. As Juno Regina ("Queen"), she holds supreme authority alongside Jupiter and Minerva in the Capitoline Triad, embodying both feminine power and state sovereignty.

relationships.allies: Minerva(fellow Capitoline deity),Vesta(virgin goddess), Bona Dea (women's mysteries), Roman matrons
relationships.enemies: Venus(rival in beauty), Trojans/Aeneas(initially),Jupiter's various lovers and illegitimate children, anyone threatening marriage sanctity

family.children: Mars(god of war),Vulcan(god of forge), Juventas (goddess of youth), Lucina (birth aspect, sometimes seen as daughter)
